title: JAM / RACIST CABIN
description: You can view the racist lorryman's cabin to get a load of his racist paraphernalia.

dialogueTree.title: Graad Factory of Magnets and Miracles U49: "A lorry stuck in the traffic jam. T..."
dialogueTree.text: A lorry stuck in the traffic jam. This big, heavy Graad-made machine is well kept for such an old machine.

links.title: You: "Look in the window."
links.text: Look in the window.

links.title: Graad Factory of Magnets and Miracles U49: "The windows are clear, they've been..."
links.text: The windows are clear, they've been recently washed. You can see a lorryman's cabin with personal belongings, stickers, insignia...

links.title: Perception (Smell): "Fumes of heavy fuel oil waft over y..."
links.text: Fumes of heavy fuel oil waft over you, making your eyes sting. The odour mixes with cigarette residue.

links.title: You: "What kind of stickers and insignia?"
links.text: What kind of stickers and insignia?

links.title: Graad Factory of Magnets and Miracles U49: "The driver has adorned his space wi..."
links.text: The driver has adorned his space with a substantial collection of peculiar paraphernalia. Proclamations about *honour*, *strength*, and *purity* are glued to various panels.

links.title: Perception (Sight): "A large metal pendant hangs from th..."
links.text: A large metal pendant hangs from the rear view mirror. The pendant features a sun crowned with wavy rays.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "It is the seal of Royalist-era Reva..."
links.text: It is the seal of Royalist-era Revachol.

links.title: You: "What about the back seat?"
links.text: What about the back seat?

links.title: Perception (Sight): "The back end of the cabin has a sma..."
links.text: The back end of the cabin has a small perch to sleep. Large ashtrays. There are several suns and wheels sown into the curtains.

links.title: Conceptualization: "A book with ragged edges catches yo..."
links.text: A book with ragged edges catches your notice. The front cover features a large, muscular man. The title reads: 'Man from Hjelmdall in the Lost City of the Pygmies'.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Racist-nationalist paraphernalia."..."
links.text: "Racist-nationalist paraphernalia." He grits his teeth. "Not unusual in this part of town. This is our guy." The lieutenant nods towards the racist lorry driver.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Racist-nationalist paraphernalia."..."
links.text: "Racist-nationalist paraphernalia." He grits his teeth. "Not unusual in this part of town."

links.title: You: ""You think this lorry belongs to ou..."
links.text: "You think this lorry belongs to our tough guy?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Likely, yes. This guy's proud of w..."
links.text: "Likely, yes. This guy's proud of who he is. Drapes it all over his machine."

links.title: Composure: "There he is, in front of Frittte, s..."
links.text: There he is, in front of Frittte, smoking nervously. Hoping it's over.

links.title: Half Light: "He was acting tough before. This de..."
links.text: He was acting tough before. This definitely scared him a little, you being here.

links.title: Half Light: "He was acting tough before. This pr..."
links.text: He was acting tough before. This probably scared him a bit. Who knows when it will come in handy -- a slightly scared racist lorryman?

links.title: You: "Look for a clue about who drives th..."
links.text: Look for a clue about who drives the vehicle.

links.title: Graad Factory of Magnets and Miracles U49: "It's clear this is your guy. Only t..."
links.text: It's clear this is your guy. Only the March edition of 'Power Man Monthly: The Pure Man's Magazine' is missing. It's clearly the rotund raceman's.

links.title: You: "[Leave.]"
links.text: [Leave.]

links.title: You: "[Leave.]"
links.text: [Leave.]
